attributes.action: Referendum on full access to EU single market before invoking Article 50.
attributes.background: Whilst respecting the EU Referendum result the Leave Campaign failed to definitively address with the electorate the issue of access to the single market. This petition seeks to ensure that full access is negotiated before Article 50 is invoked. If this cannot be achieved a referendum must be held.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on the UK joining the European Free Trade Association (EFTA)
attributes.background: EFTA is a free trade area and currently includes Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland. It operates in parallel with the EU, and all its member states participate in the EU's single market. Norway rejected membership of the EU in national referendums in 1973 and 1995, but stayed in EFTA.

attributes.action: Lower the Voting Age to 15 so 15-17 year olds can vote.
attributes.background: I think that people aged 15 and above should have the right to vote in future Referendums and Prime Minister Elections. Young adults are taught in Schools about Politics and the Government so they will have a clear understanding of why and what they are voting for.

attributes.action: Hold a new EU referendum if there is a major shift in public opinion.
attributes.background: The consequences of leave have, until now, been pure speculation.  They are now facts and becoming clear: a fall in the pound, threatened major job losses, the break up of the UK.  Had these consequences been clear before the vote, the public may have voted differently and should confirm the vote.

attributes.action: Set up an inquiry into the impact of press reporting on the Brexit vote
attributes.background: A referendum such as on Brexit relies on informed decision making by the public. It is understandable that each side will represent their position in the best light possible. But we need to understand if any persons manipulated public opinion through press reporting beyond the legally acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: Just like the Chilcot inquiry into the Iraq war and the potential manipulation of public opinion through the media, we need a similar inquiry about whether any actors had vested interest in a Brexit and if so, whether they did take any steps to manipulate public opinion in an unacceptable, illegal manner by impacting press reporting on Brexit.

attributes.action: Implement a 2nd EU Referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the HM Government to debate and implement a second referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote as the results effect everyone not only voters aged 18 and over.

attributes.action: Demand a re-evaluation of the Barnett Formula in the wake of leaving the EU
attributes.background: Due to gross inequality in the funding of the home nations by Westminister thus far, extra help from the EU pot has been essential in order to help some regions of the UK to thrive. Now that we've voted to leave, the Barnett Formula must be re-evaluated and modified to meet the needs of the people.
attributes.additional_details: Devolution: What's the Barnett formula? - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-29477233

attributes.action: Petition for London and the South East to breakaway from the UK
attributes.background: After the Brexit vote, London clearly has a different stance on the future to the rest of the country. London also has a vastly different economy to the rest of the country so breaking away makes sesne
attributes.additional_details:
Regional Brexit vote split

http://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2016-brexit-referendum/

attributes.action: Adjust the status of UK residents on Tier2 ICT visa or cancel it from visa types
attributes.background: The Tier2 ICT visa is a new modern slavery, this visa status takes away all your privileges as a human. You pay equal tax as a UK resident yet because people knows that you can't stay for longer than 5 years there are many things you cant do, in my case: adopt, get a mortgage, change jobs and more
attributes.additional_details: UK government have changed the laws so that everyone who's living in UK for more than 183 days becomes a resident and pay tax, however, people in Tier2 ICT visa status do not get any benefits to the contrary, if they can't find a job outside UK within 5 years they end up paying an equal tax to a resident, stuck in a job they don't want to do (many employers abuse there ICT people because they know they own them), no bank will give you a mortgage because they can't trust what will happen to you in 5 years.

attributes.action: Government fund Boot Camps for teenagers instead of children's homes and units
attributes.background: More and more children and teenagers become worse off after being referred to care homes and units. The reason being is that they end up establishing new relationships with others who have considerably worse issues. The result of this can have a severe negative impact rather than help the situation.
attributes.additional_details: We want to prevent children and teenagers from enduring this type of situation. They also regularly go missing from homes resulting in more police resources. Police have confirmed that missing children is a regularity which is often a waste of police time. If we were to introduce teenage bootcamps it would prevent a lot of future crime and saving expenses on services such as police, social work, alcohol addiction, drug rehabilitation, psychologists, prison sentences, teenage pregnancies and more

attributes.action: Call for a vote of no confidence in PM Cameron post EU referendum.
attributes.background: In the event of a leave majority in the forth coming EU referendum we the people request that all Members of Parliament be made directly aware by the House of Commons Speaker to the announcement of our desire for a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister David Cameron.

attributes.action: Boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background:
After the violence and racism by Russian supporters in the Euro 2016 football tournament in France. 
I would like the Government Ministers to boycott anything to do with the 2018 World Cup in Russia.
attributes.additional_details: If our government can do this. It will show they are looking out for the safety of the British Citizens which would be at risk if they were to fly out there. And with Government support, the British people, FA, World Cup sponsors and other qualifying countries may consider boycotting the tournament as well. Our Gouvernment needs to show it will not support at tournament that was won on bribes and cannot promise the safety of the British public.

attributes.action: Make vaccine inserts mandatory to receive before being given any vaccination.
attributes.background: This isn't about being pro or anti vaccinations. This is about knowledge and being able to make an informed choice in whichever choice you choose.
attributes.additional_details: By reading the vaccine insert it will help educate the person on the possible adverse reactions, it will help parents notice vaccine damage a lot earlier if it arises, you will be able to read the study details and see all ingredients in the vaccination before deciding to go ahead with them.

attributes.action: Public Inquiry and full disclosure of corrupt covert operations
attributes.background:
Request for:
- Public Inquiry
- Full disclosure of official files 
of crimes by State of Human Rights violations against innocent individuals and / or their families subjected to misuse of covert operations and secrets act (including removal of exclusion notices to the innocent person's file).
attributes.additional_details: A person or family to be placed under covert operations must be a threat to national security by government, law enforcement, secret and security organisation, such as espionage, serious crimes and terrorism.  An innocent person exercising their legal rights in any context that is to democratic laws / policy is not a threat to State. Neither should be subjected to misuse of covert operations and their Human Rights violated.  All records collated constitute criminal evidence by such contravention.

attributes.action: Stop testing children in Year 1 on 'alien' words (words that have been made up)!
attributes.background: In Year 1 children take a phonics check.  It is a test made up of real and 'made up' words.  The child is tested to make sure their phonics knowledge is at the expected level.  They should only be tested on real words that are in the dictionary.
attributes.additional_details: It seems so silly to test children who can read fluently on words they will never come across again as they are no where to be found within the English dictionary.  Words such as 'quather' or 'jove'.  The English language is not a phonetically correct language.  We have 26 letters and 44 sounds (43 in some areas because of dialect differences).  Rules for some words are not the same for other words for example, come and home.  The 'o' sound in both words are very different.

attributes.action: Close all remaining 'City' zoo's.
attributes.background: After the events this bank holiday weekend, we feel enough is enough. No longer shall we pay to see animals held in closed captivity. City zoo's across the country should be closed. With such great places as West Midlands safari etc there is no need for city zoo's, anymore.

attributes.action: Make London the test city for medical/recreational marijuana
attributes.background:
Create a legal market for marijuana in the UK. With the goal of taking money out of crinmals hands, collecting tax to be used in the health and education sector and to get access to an organic substance that is safer than alcohol.
Age Limit - 20+
Possession for personal consumption - 2 Ounces

attributes.action: Referendum to change Britain into a secular republic with an elected  president.
attributes.background: We must give the British people a voice over the one that has stolen our voice.
attributes.additional_details: It's an embarrassment to democracy for us to have an unelected head of state. The Monarchy system is old fashioned and out-dated. Not only is it undemocratic but the British taxpayer spends billions of pounds to an the British monarchy when it could be used to save the NHS and solve the housing crisis in Britain. British society is based on meritocracy and how can Britain claim this with a rich blood-line monarchy which is based on birth.

attributes.action: Mandatory air rifle registration with a 2 year period to register.
attributes.background:
Make mandatory registration of air rifles.
Currently in the UK anyone can own an air rifle & use these to illegally shoot on lands without permission committing the acts of armed trespass and poaching.
Some shoot pets escape prosecution and costs owners thousands of pounds!
www.ukgunbook.com
attributes.additional_details:
By making registration mandatory ( 2 year period to register ) it will help solve crimes of pets that have been shot and / or killed.
It will also make sure that owners are punished for offences committed with their weapons.
We dont want to stop people shooting, we just want to ensure those that own weapons are using them sensibly, on lands with permission.
Similar to the UK Gunlaws on ShotGun ownership.
£15 per weapon registration and £10 per year renewal fees for up to 10 serialised weapons.

attributes.action: Introduce a rule to prevent the trading of insults and irrelevant remarks at PMQ
attributes.background: The Prime Minister as an elected public official and head of the UK government, responsible for the policy and decisions of the government should not be using PMQ as an opportunity to trade insults and to make irrelevant remarks that do not relate to questions posed.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months responses, quality of debate and the PM's behaviour at PMQ has reached a level that is now unacceptable, as it condones behaviour that would not be accepted in other spheres of society or workplace. The House of Parliament is a working environment, in which MPs of all parties are paid by UK tax payers to govern and formulate policies to benefit society, therefore it is right and proper that questions asked at PMQ are answered in a respectful manner.

attributes.action: Debate the EU's Five Presidents’ Report & its likely impact on the UK.
attributes.background:
The report proposes the completion of Europe’s Economic, Monetary & Political Union.  It uses the terms 'euro area' and 'EU' in relation to its propositions; thus a likely impact on non-euro sovereign states such as the UK.
My concern is that our MPs are not fully aware of its content or impact.
attributes.additional_details:
The report can be accessed at: https://ec.europa.eu/priorities/publications/five-presidents-report-completing-europes-economic-and-monetary-union_en.
It states, 'And finally, towards a Political Union that provides the foundation - - - '. 
It uses doublespeak such as, 'The euro is a successful and stable currency', not withstanding the intractable problems a common currency has given countries such as Greece.

attributes.action: Strip police officers who have falsified statements, of their Police Pension.
attributes.background: We petition the Government to strip police officers found to have falsified statements following and relating to the Hillsborough Disaster of 15 April 1989 of their Police Pension. It is disgraceful that in the years since lies have been perpetuated. Change the law, enabling stripping of pensions.

attributes.action: Ban diesel fuel! We deserve cleaner air.
attributes.background: Diesel fuel is slowly killing us. Let's get rid of it and live healthier, longer lives.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/apr/21/all-top-selling-cars-break-emissions-limits-in-real-world-tests

attributes.action: Government must provide Framework Documents on governance after EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Government provided the People of the UK with a referendum on whether they wish to stay in or leave the EU. The Government must therefore provide two framework documents that give clear guidance on how the UK would be governed under each option so that the People can reach a considered decision
attributes.additional_details:
Background information on why the Government should provide these two framework documents and the consequences if they do not, can be reviewed by the following link

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6nprf1f6wrth3bx/The%20forthcoming%20EU%20Referendum_Revision%201_Final%20Draft.pdf?dl=0

attributes.action: It's time to make the UK Lottery have minimum pay-outs
attributes.background: There should be minimum pay-outs for 4, 5, and 5 plus the bonus ball. It should come out of their exorbitant profits, they have already moved the goalposts by increasing the price and numbers on the draw , time to be fairer, or time for a total boycott

attributes.action: Stop the closure of malling health at telford town centre
attributes.background: It was announced today that the walk in centre and gp practise is being closed down leaving over 3000 patients without a gp please help stop this up coming closure it took me a long time to find a decent gp and have been at this gp practise myself for 6 years

attributes.action: Make childcare costs exempt from Income tax
attributes.background:
We request the Government to make the child care costs exempt from income tax. This will help in two ways
1. Help provide relief to families 
2. Help bring more people especially women into the workforce.
attributes.additional_details:
1. According to an OECD report - The UK has the highest costs of childcare for any country apart from Switzerland - 26.6% of average family incomes, compared to an OECD average of 11.8%.  
2.  While the long term solution would be to bring the childcare costs down, making them tax exempt would atleast provide some relief in the interim.
3. Families are bringing up the future generation, who will work, contribute to pensions, support the elderly and society.

attributes.action: Training on Mental Health for Ambulance service
attributes.background: It appears the Ambulance staff do not get the relevant training in Mental Health and they are faced with Mental Health patients on a daily basis. This is becoming more common but frontline staff do not have the skills to deal with risky, suicidal patients, why are they not having the training?
attributes.additional_details: As Mental Health is becoming more common as physical health it is agreed by frontline staff and Mental Health staff that they should have adequate training in Mental Health.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to ride 125cc motorbikes
attributes.background: Restricting a 16 year old to a 50cc, which by law can only go 30mph is dangerous, when you think that most roads they ride on are faster than 30mph. An example of this issue is a country road, where the speed limit is 60mph, so that's a 30mph difference.

attributes.action: Free fruit should be given to children in schools! To promote healthilyLifestyle
attributes.background: Free fruit should be given out to children in schools to help promote healthier lifestyle to combate vast illness.Like obesity,dieabetes and other chronic illness.This would help take some pressure off the NHS ,improve people general health and well-being and mental health!
attributes.additional_details:
(NCMP) 2014/15, show that 19.1% of children in Year 6 (aged 10-11) were obese and a further 14.2% were overweight. Of children in Reception (aged 4-5), 9.1% were obese and another 12.8% were overweight. This means a third of 10-11 year olds and over a fifth of 4-5 year olds were overweight or obese. 

Estimated of (those costs arising from the impact of obesity on the wider economy such as loss of productivity) over the same time period ranged between £2.6 billion [1] and £15.8 billion.[2]

attributes.action: Demand a public inquiry into how EU medical expenses have been going unclaimed.
attributes.background: New figures show the NHS is paying out millions more for EU healthcare than it is claiming back from EU countries.Described as a "scandalous failure",it has emerged that the UK pays more than £670m to EU countries for Brits' healthcare abroad, while claiming back less than £50m from the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
MP John Mann, who obtained the figures in a parliamentary question, told Sky News that "logically the UK should be receiving more than it pays out".

He estimates "the real cost is a billion pounds a year". 

Mr Mann told Sky News: "Other countries are recharging and we are not.

"The figures are astonishing - we are paying them 70 times more than they are paying us.

attributes.action: Consider recommissioning fallout shelters in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: A Donald Trump presidency will introduce a large element of unpredictability into geopolitics. We as a nation need to take steps to prepare ourselves for every eventuality, up to and including nuclear war.
attributes.additional_details: Our network of Nuclear shelters has fallen out of use following the close of the Cold War. With sites such as Burlington falling into disrepair. These sites are located within many of our towns and cities and would provide a small measure of safety and the continuation of the British way of life in the event of a disaster.

attributes.action: Stop the bedroom tax in wales
attributes.background: a lot of people are and have lost their homes due to the bedroom tax family members die or move out of there family home to start new lives and that leaves families under size for the house they live in. then gets crippled with bedroom tax charges in social housing .
attributes.additional_details: people move out for social housing to rent private to avoid bedroom tax.This alone will cost hosing benefit more if they are claiming housing benefit has the rent is a lot more in private rent then social rent.So don't it make it cheaper and easier for the government to abolish bedroom tax? and maybe then people can afford to say in social housing where to rent cost much less and people would not need to ask for Discretionary Housing Payments then/ask for help with finding bonds for new housing

attributes.action: To revoke British Citizenship and passport if you commit a crime
attributes.background: To make a law that any person given British Citizenship and passport who commits a criminal offence and are jailed then the British Citizenship and passport are revoked and they are deported to their country of origin.

attributes.action: The local education authority should be put back in charge of schools.
attributes.background: I have had an issue with my daughters primary school head and where ever I go to complain I'm told I must go through the Govenors which is pointless as they are all directed by the headteacher, who is not answerable to anyone

attributes.action: I want the government to STOP the privatization of the UK.
attributes.background: As 4 year "custodians" of the UK they have no right to sell what is not theirs to sell, their job is to govern the UK for 4 years, if the governments only solution to fixing the UK is to sell it to the highest bidder, they are not fit for purpose, a window cleaner dosnt sell his ladders!
attributes.additional_details:
Too many conflicts of interest surround MPs and their interest to privatize the NHS, The Royal Mail was sold at less than its worth, almost our entire infrastructure has been sold off like some crack addict looking for their next HIT, the list spanning 40 years is shameful and it must stop and stop NOW, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_privatizations#United_Kingdom
Please support this petition and fight to hold onto whats left of OUR infrastructure paid for from OUR taxes, Thank you.

attributes.action: Call for an independent review of the recent local government finance settlement
attributes.background: “The Government announced a £300m fund to help ease the pain of the cuts, but instead of giving it to areas that have had the biggest cuts, they gave it to wealthier areas run by Conservative councils that have had the least cuts since 2010.
attributes.additional_details: After complaints that Government funding cuts were too severe, the Government announced a £300m ‘relief fund’ to help affected areas.  But instead of targeting the money on areas with the biggest cuts, 85% of it has been sent to areas with the lowest levels of deprivation that have experienced the least cuts. Most of these areas are run by Conservative councils. There are concerns public money was used as a political fix to buy votes for the Tories in the run-up to elections in May.

attributes.action: Bring licensing back for dogs and cats UK. A cost of £1 per year per animal.
attributes.background: Dog licensing was abolished in 1984, in most countries it is mandatory to have a license for an animal you own. It is like registering a car to the legal owner. If an animal was to stray or get run over alongside the new microchipping laws, there would be a greater chance of getting a pet back home.
attributes.additional_details: All registrations would begin on 6th April, and must be renewed by 31 March, every year. Each registered dog or cat must wear a tag specifying the council, registration expiry date, and registration number of the dog, with the colour of the tag changing every year for easy identification .  Fees for working dogs (herding dogs, police dogs, drug dogs, etc.) are generally lower than for pets, and seeing-eye or hearing-ear dogs would be  free or minimal cost to register.

attributes.action: Restrict child benefit to children only residing in the UK
attributes.background: Child benefit should only be paid to children whilst they live and receive full time education in the UK

attributes.action: Allow buyer to retain 5% of new build house price until build quality is correct
attributes.background: I am a new home owner. A year after moving in, I am fighting the house builder to complete my home to a satisfactory standard. Many of my neighbours are in a similar position. An incentive must be provided for the house builder to complete the house to the required quality standards.
attributes.additional_details: The house builder currently is paid the full amount of the house on exchange no matter how poor the quality of house delivered. New home buyers need more protection - the 10 year warranty is not sufficient to protect against poor quality. If the home buyer can retain 5% of the purchase price, then if the home builder cannot deliver the home to the required cosmetic and structural quality (which can be independently verified), then the home buyer should be allowed to keep the retained capital.

attributes.action: Give Us An Annual Poppy Day For All Animals To Be Remembered.
attributes.background:
Over the years there have been many pets that became War Animals who served and died for many different countries and yet there isn't a single DAY that commemorates ANY of them; War Animals Or Our Treasured Pets.  
Help us to gain momentum - and give the animals what they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
The idea for it came from author Jilly Cooper and some of her friends, a group of influential personalities in their own right, who in 1996 started the 'Animals in War' Memorial Fund with Anne, HRH The Princess Royal, as patron. Jilly herself donated to the fund all the royalties from her successful book Animals at War.  After a long and challenging nationwide fundraising operation the memorial was completed, it took 8 years.

Not many people are aware this monument exists.
Help us please.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close Bedford ​Magistrates' Court.
attributes.background: The county town of Bedfordshire is slowly losing its identity.  Our court building with its imposing façade demands respect for the justice deliberated within its walls. To take this away, will rip more of the soul from our town. When will central Government consult us taxpayers?
attributes.additional_details:
Mayor of Bedford Dave Hodgson said: "It will make permanent the delays to the administration of justice that we've seen already. Alongside the threat to the future of the hospital as we know it and the punitive cuts to the council's funding, this is part of a sustained assault on local services."

Read more: http://www.bedfordshire-news.co.uk/8203-Magistrates-closure-undermines-justice/story-28724251-detail/story.html#ixzz40Gt3ljWW

attributes.action: Stop charging patients for recreational services in hospitals.
attributes.background:
In hospitals, patients have to pay money to use recreational services offered such as TVs. 

Electricity is wasted to power the TVs to show adverts, yet the patients have to pay money if they want to watch a film or channel.
attributes.additional_details:
It is immoral to be charging a patient for recreational services when they have already been installed and are already using electricity to display adverts. 

Being entertained is an essential element of human biology and psychology, so why are patients being denied of that? 

A compromise for not making TVs free would be to provide free books, magazines, or games which could be donated to the hospital by people.

attributes.action: Ban unsolicited physical post (Junk mail)
attributes.background:
We get a ridiculous amount of unsolicited post on a daily basis. Most of us put it straight in the bin without even looking at it. 
If it were banned, we'd all be less irritated, and the UK's carbon footprint will get a significant reduction.

attributes.action: Review how child maintenance is calculated for self employed fathers
attributes.background: Self employed fathers pay far less than employed fathers and by unrealistic calculations. Self employed figures are based on profit after travelling expenses, vehicle finance, fuel and telephone etc are deducted from their gross figure. Employed fathers who earn less gross pay far more
attributes.additional_details: An employed father who earns £500 gross per week would pay £100.00 per week. He would also have same traveling and living expenses as the self employed father yet this is not taken into account. Too many self employed fathers abuse this system as an excuse to take little financial responsibility for their children. In most cases the self employed are living high standards of living whilst employed fathers struggle with general living. Self employed fathers should be calculated on realisticly

attributes.action: Save Age UK Training Center, Preston, Lancashire
attributes.background: The petition is to protest against the EFA/SFA closing down the center due to a failed Ofsted report (in which they did not even come to our center). Jobs will be lost as well as training opportunities for the 16-19 year olds that attend Age UK, most of which struggle with the usual college system.
attributes.additional_details: Age UK is the last training center of its kind based in Preston with specific targeted courses for the students, such as Business Admin and Maths training. It is a small environment designed to help students less suited to a large college environment and an alternative to college for over a decade. 16-19 Year old learners that have various issues ranging from anxiety to social skills will no longer have anywhere to gain education as Age UK Training was the last trainer of this sort in Preston.

attributes.action: give our homeless and ex service men and women homes before asylum seekers
attributes.background: our homeless and ex service men and women need home more then asylum seekers you can walk around any town or city and you will see how many homeless men and women are around yet when an asylum seekers comes to the uk there house is ready and waiting and I and a lot of over people think this is wrong
attributes.additional_details: my evidence is all around as someone who has been homeless I know the struggles and to be told it will take 5 years plus to get a flat/house is wrong yet asylum seekers can be given a property within the first 24 hours after arriving we need to get our own people sorted before we can even think about helping anyone else

attributes.action: Legally require adjacent schools to align their school holiday schedule.
attributes.background: Adjacent schools, serving different age groups, are attended by siblings from one family. Misaligned school holidays mean: the family cannot take a holiday & financial hardship as the parents have to cover childcare for four weeks instead of two (i.e. time away from work or child care costs).
attributes.additional_details: Further impacts include: less revenue to the British tourism industry, inconveniencing employers and preventing/further discouraging mothers from working thus claiming benefits. Schools are allowed to fine parents if children do not attend, yet schools are under no obligation to consider the constraints of working parents. Aligning the school holidays causes schools literally no inconvenience what so ever.

attributes.action: Raise the BMI cap for fertility treatment
attributes.background:
Currently only women with a BMI of 30 or lower is eligible for fertility treatment.
It has been proven that the BMI system is flawed and does not take bone density etc. into account
attributes.additional_details: I believe that there are many women who have successful pregnancies with a BMI over 30 who are fortunate to not have a fertility problem therefore why should women who have conditions such as PCOS (where it is proven that it is harder to maintain or lose weight with this condition) be penalised and rejected when they are the people who really need the treatment.

attributes.action: Introduce a regulatory body for housing officers!
attributes.background: Over the past year of assisting people, I have noticed, along with others that there is a pattern emerging of housing officers abusing their power and not being held to account for their actions.
attributes.additional_details: The ONLY case for this that was ever brought forward was AA v London Borough Southwark [2014], where 3 housing officers were found guilty of conspiracy and misfeasance in a public office. More need held to account and the only way we can do this is to have a regulatory body for ALL housing officers!
